page.title: 17ARTS AND CRAFTS
page.content: {ARTS AND CRAFTS. } {LACEMAKING. } This a form of weaving done by hand on a special pillow (a circular hard wood base covered with calico and stuffed with chopped straw to give a domed appearance and the whole covered with a smooth non-hairy fabric). The thread used is wound onto pairs of bobbins and these are then manipulated to form patterns which are held in place by pins. There are two lace makers in the area one of whom has become a teacher and designer of lace and is also the President of the North West Lace Makers Association. She has designed a bedspread to be made of squares of lace. The squares are at present being made by her students and when completed the bedspread will be exhibited at the Lace Guild Exhibition in 1986.
